lead_paragraph: SEINFELD--Evelyn. It is with profound sadness that we announce the loss of Evelyn Seinfeld, 68, on Monday, June 20, 2016, after a courageous battle with cancer. She was predeceased by her mother, Libby Seinfeld, father, Louis Seinfeld, and brother, Melvyn Seinfeld. She is survived by loving twin sister Phyllis Feinberg of Dobbs Ferry, NY, and sister and brother-in-law Bernice and Norman Colten of Ocean, NJ; devoted nieces Rachel Feldman of Bergenfield, NJ, Jennifer Colten of Arlington, VA, and Marissa Kaplan-Dobbs, Lee Miuccio, and nephew Jake Kaplan, all of Brooklyn, NY; proud great-nieces Malka and Esther Feldman, Grace Miuccio, and Ruby Dobbs; and great-nephews Jack Miuccio, Simcha, Yosef, and Moshe Feldman. A lifelong resident of Brooklyn, NY, Evelyn advocated for 125,000 employees of the City of New York as the director of research and negotiations for DC37. She retired after over 40 years in public service. Evelyn was fiercely dedicated to improving the lives of others, as evidenced by her success as a contract negotiator and enforcer. She enjoyed spending time with her family and cherished friends, especially when coffee and New York Times crossword puzzles were involved. She was a source of comfort and guidance to all who knew her, and her memory will live on in those inspired by her generosity of spirit. Donations in Evelyn's name may be made to Congregation Sons of Israel, 1 Poplar Place, Ocean, New Jersey 07712 or Jobs with Justice at www.jwj.org. 1/3
